intro: Parosela polydenia var. subnuda, commonly known as the slender parosela, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, feathery appearance. The flowers, which are small and white, bloom in late spring and attract various pollinators.
